title: Catching histones by the tail: A new probe to track histone modifications in living cells

title_detail.value: Catching histones by the tail: A new probe to track histone modifications in living cells

summary: Scientists have developed a sensitive fluorescent antibody probe that specifically detects monomethylation of lysine 20 in histone H4 in living cells. This research has future implications and can be used to monitor the dynamics of histone modifications and genome integrity in single living cells without disturbing cellular functions.
